name: Gopachal Parvat Jain Sculptures
description: Ancient Jain rock-cut idols carved between the 7th–15th centuries.
story: Gopachal Parvat (also known as Gopanchal Parvat) is a magnificent collection of ancient Jain rock-cut sculptures...

name: Tomb of Muhammad Ghaus
description: Magnificent Mughal-era sandstone tomb of Sufi saint Muhammad Ghaus.
story: The Tomb of Muhammad Ghaus is an exquisite 16th-century Mughal monument...

name: Gwalior Fort
description: Majestic hilltop fort known as the 'Gibraltar of India'.
story: Gwalior Fort, often called the Gibraltar of India, is one of the most magnificent hill forts...

name: Gwalior Zoo (Gandhi Zoo)
description: Green oasis with tigers, deer, birds and heritage structures.
story: Gwalior Zoo, also known as Gandhi Zoo, is a beloved urban wildlife center...

name: Jai Vilas Palace & Scindia Museum
description: 19th-century palace with European architectural influence and royal artifacts.
story: Jai Vilas Palace was built in 1874 by Maharaja Jayajirao Scindia...

name: Man Mandir Palace
description: Historic palace inside Gwalior Fort known for tile work & chambers.
story: Man Mandir Palace, built by King Man Singh Tomar, is famed for its artistic beauty...

name: Padavali & Mitaoli Temples
description: Believed to be the inspiration behind India's Parliament.
story: Padavali and Mitaoli are twin temples known for early central Indian architecture...

name: Sai Baba Temple
description: A peaceful and spiritual center dedicated to Sai Baba.
story: The Sai Baba Temple of Gwalior is a serene devotional space...

name: Sas-Bahu Temple
description: 11th-century temple pair with brilliant carvings inside Gwalior Fort.
story: The Sas-Bahu temples are famous for their intricate stone carvings...

name: Sun Temple (Surya Mandir)
description: Modern sandstone temple inspired by Konark Sun Temple.
story: Gwalior’s Sun Temple is a beautiful Birla-built shrine...

name: Teli Ka Mandir
description: Tallest temple inside Gwalior Fort with a blend of Dravidian architecture.
story: Teli Ka Mandir is known for its fusion of North and South Indian designs...

name: Tigra Dam
description: Popular picnic spot offering boating and scenic views.
story: Tigra Dam forms a major water reservoir serving Gwalior...

name: Tomb of Tansen
description: Resting place of the legendary musician Tansen.
story: The Tomb of Tansen is a sacred place for music lovers...
